title: JSON
description: Parses JSON documents with optional splitting and mappings

label.title: Label
label.description: A label for this Parser Stage

mediaTypes.title: Media Types to match
mediaTypes.description: Documents with a media type on this list will be matched by this parser stage. See inheritMediaTypes / use default media types for more.

inheritMediaTypes.title: Match default media types in this Parser Stage
inheritMediaTypes.description: Each parser stage has a built-in list of media types it handles by default. If this setting is true, that list will be used along with any optional additional types provided in the mediaTypes list. If this setting is false, this stage will only be selected for media types in the mediaTypes list, and the mediaTypes list becomes a mandatory property which must have at least one valid media type.

ignoredMediaTypes.title: Media Types to ignore
ignoredMediaTypes.description: Documents with a media type on this list will be not be processed by this parser stage.

pathPatterns.title: File names to parse
pathPatterns.description: Specify a file name or pattern that must be matched for this parser stage to run. Forward slashes ("/") are used to join names of files inside archives with the archive name.

syntax.title: Pattern type
syntax.description: glob uses bash shell-style wildcards; regex uses Java (PCRE-style) regex

pattern.title: File name or pattern
pattern.description: e.g.: "z.txt" or "*.md" or "/a/*/b/f.txt" for glob; "z.txt$" or ".*\.txt$" or "^/a/[^\/]*/b/f.txt$" for regex

outputFieldPrefix.title: Prefix parsed fields with
outputFieldPrefix.description: Fields extracted by this parser will be prefixed with this string. The remainder of the field name will be as detected in the stream

rootPath.title: Root path
rootPath.description: Use only children of this JSON pointer.

includePath.title: Include root path
includePath.description: Include parent element names when using a root path.

splitArrays.title: Split arrays
splitArrays.description: First split top-level arrays into multiple documents, and then apply other rules.

mappings.title: Mapping rules
mappings.description: Extract parts of the document into specified fields

listHandling.title: JSON List handling
listHandling.description: Create a single multivalued field containing all items, or a separate index-numbered field per list item?
